title: CRISPR/Cas libraries open new avenues in cancer research

title_detail.value: CRISPR/Cas libraries open new avenues in cancer research

summary: CRISPR/Cas enables the targeted deactivation of genes by cutting DNA at pre-determined sites. This is accomplished by providing the Cas enzyme with a genetic zip code. Using an entire library of zip codes, it is then possible to simultaneously probe multiple sites within the genome, for example to determine which genes are essential for cancer cell survival. This could revolutionize drug discovery.
